subject: Sharing fixtures

messageBody:
Hi. I read the documentation on junit.org, but it's not really clear
to me how I actually share a fixture. I'm probably completely off
track in regards to what the cookbook actually tries to explain,
but I wish multiple tests (as separate classes) to work on a common
set of fixtures. Is the proper way to have the fixtures as static
variables in a separate class? From the documentation I gathered:

import junit.framework.*;

/*
Setting up fixtures
*/
public class Fixtures extends TestCase {

int test = -1;

public Fixtures(String name) {
super(name);
}

public void setUp() {
test = 0;
}

public void testByDelegation() {
new FixtureTest("testSharedFixture");
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.main(new String[]
{Fixtures.class.getName()});
}
}


import junit.framework.*;

public class FixtureTest extends Fixtures {

public FixtureTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

public void testSharedFixture() {
//This assertion never gets carried out
assertEquals(0, test);
}
}


But I suspect that this is not what the cookbook tries to
explain to me...

Best regards,

Morten
